properties.name: AdjustmentType
properties.description: Specifies how the ScalingAdjustment value in a StepAdjustment is interpreted.

type.description: Specifies how the ScalingAdjustment value in a StepAdjustment is interpreted.

properties.name: Cooldown
properties.description: The amount of time, in seconds, to wait for a previous scaling activity to take effect.

type.description: The amount of time, in seconds, to wait for a previous scaling activity to take effect.

properties.name: MetricAggregationType
properties.description: The aggregation type for the CloudWatch metrics. Valid values are Minimum, Maximum, and Average. If the aggregation type is null, the value is treated as Average

type.description: The aggregation type for the CloudWatch metrics. Valid values are Minimum, Maximum, and Average. If the aggregation type is null, the value is treated as Average

properties.name: MinAdjustmentMagnitude
properties.description: The minimum value to scale by when the adjustment type is PercentChangeInCapacity.

type.description: The minimum value to scale by when the adjustment type is PercentChangeInCapacity.

properties.name: StepAdjustments
properties.description: A set of adjustments that enable you to scale based on the size of the alarm breach.

type.description: A set of adjustments that enable you to scale based on the size of the alarm breach.

properties.name: CustomizedMetricSpecification
properties.description: A customized metric. You can specify either a predefined metric or a customized metric.

type.description: A customized metric. You can specify either a predefined metric or a customized metric.

properties.name: DisableScaleIn
properties.description: Indicates whether scale in by the target tracking scaling policy is disabled. If the value is true, scale in is disabled and the target tracking scaling policy won't remove capacity from the scalable target. Otherwise, scale in is enabled and the target tracking scaling policy can remove capacity from the scalable target. The default value is false.

type.description: Indicates whether scale in by the target tracking scaling policy is disabled. If the value is true, scale in is disabled and the target tracking scaling policy won't remove capacity from the scalable target. Otherwise, scale in is enabled and the target tracking scaling policy can remove capacity from the scalable target. The default value is false.

properties.name: PredefinedMetricSpecification
properties.description: A predefined metric. You can specify either a predefined metric or a customized metric.

type.description: A predefined metric. You can specify either a predefined metric or a customized metric.

properties.name: ScaleInCooldown
properties.description: The amount of time, in seconds, after a scale-in activity completes before another scale-in activity can start.

type.description: The amount of time, in seconds, after a scale-in activity completes before another scale-in activity can start.

properties.name: ScaleOutCooldown
properties.description: The amount of time, in seconds, to wait for a previous scale-out activity to take effect.

type.description: The amount of time, in seconds, to wait for a previous scale-out activity to take effect.

properties.name: TargetValue
properties.description: The target value for the metric. Although this property accepts numbers of type Double, it won't accept values that are either too small or too large. Values must be in the range of -2^360 to 2^360. The value must be a valid number based on the choice of metric. For example, if the metric is CPU utilization, then the target value is a percent value that represents how much of the CPU can be used before scaling out.

type.description: The target value for the metric. Although this property accepts numbers of type Double, it won't accept values that are either too small or too large. Values must be in the range of -2^360 to 2^360. The value must be a valid number based on the choice of metric. For example, if the metric is CPU utilization, then the target value is a percent value that represents how much of the CPU can be used before scaling out.

PredefinedMetricSpecification.description: Represents a predefined metric for a target tracking scaling policy to use with Application Auto Scaling.

properties.name: PredefinedMetricType
properties.description: The metric type. The ALBRequestCountPerTarget metric type applies only to Spot Fleets and ECS services.

type.description: The metric type. The ALBRequestCountPerTarget metric type applies only to Spot Fleets and ECS services.

properties.name: ResourceLabel
properties.description: Identifies the resource associated with the metric type. You can't specify a resource label unless the metric type is ALBRequestCountPerTarget and there is a target group attached to the Spot Fleet or ECS service.

type.description: Identifies the resource associated with the metric type. You can't specify a resource label unless the metric type is ALBRequestCountPerTarget and there is a target group attached to the Spot Fleet or ECS service.

CustomizedMetricSpecification.description: Represents a CloudWatch metric of your choosing for a target tracking scaling policy to use with Application Auto Scaling.

properties.name: Dimensions
properties.description: The dimensions of the metric.

type.description: The dimensions of the metric.

properties.name: MetricName
properties.description: The name of the metric. To get the exact metric name, namespace, and dimensions, inspect the Metric object that is returned by a call to ListMetrics.

type.description: The name of the metric. To get the exact metric name, namespace, and dimensions, inspect the Metric object that is returned by a call to ListMetrics.

properties.name: Namespace
properties.description: The namespace of the metric.

type.description: The namespace of the metric.

properties.name: Statistic
properties.description: The statistic of the metric.

type.description: The statistic of the metric.

properties.name: Unit
properties.description: The unit of the metric. For a complete list of the units that CloudWatch supports, see the MetricDatum data type in the Amazon CloudWatch API Reference.

type.description: The unit of the metric. For a complete list of the units that CloudWatch supports, see the MetricDatum data type in the Amazon CloudWatch API Reference.

properties.name: Metrics
properties.description: The metrics to include in the target tracking scaling policy, as a metric data query. This can include both raw metric and metric math expressions.

type.description: The metrics to include in the target tracking scaling policy, as a metric data query. This can include both raw metric and metric math expressions.

TargetTrackingMetricDataQuery.description: The metric data to return. Also defines whether this call is returning data for one metric only, or whether it is performing a math expression on the values of returned metric statistics to create a new time series. A time series is a series of data points, each of which is associated with a timestamp.

properties.name: Expression
properties.description: The math expression to perform on the returned data, if this object is performing a math expression.

type.description: The math expression to perform on the returned data, if this object is performing a math expression.

properties.name: Id
properties.description: A short name that identifies the object's results in the response.

type.description: A short name that identifies the object's results in the response.

properties.name: Label
properties.description: A human-readable label for this metric or expression. This is especially useful if this is a math expression, so that you know what the value represents.

type.description: A human-readable label for this metric or expression. This is especially useful if this is a math expression, so that you know what the value represents.

properties.name: ReturnData
properties.description: Indicates whether to return the timestamps and raw data values of this metric.

type.description: Indicates whether to return the timestamps and raw data values of this metric.

properties.name: MetricStat
properties.description: Information about the metric data to return.

type.description: Information about the metric data to return.

TargetTrackingMetricStat.description: This structure defines the CloudWatch metric to return, along with the statistic, period, and unit.

properties.name: Metric
properties.description: The CloudWatch metric to return, including the metric name, namespace, and dimensions.

type.description: The CloudWatch metric to return, including the metric name, namespace, and dimensions.

properties.name: Stat
properties.description: The statistic to return. It can include any CloudWatch statistic or extended statistic.

type.description: The statistic to return. It can include any CloudWatch statistic or extended statistic.

properties.name: Unit
properties.description: The unit to use for the returned data points.

type.description: The unit to use for the returned data points.

properties.name: Dimensions
properties.description: The dimensions for the metric.

type.description: The dimensions for the metric.

properties.name: MetricName
properties.description: The name of the metric.

type.description: The name of the metric.

properties.name: Namespace
properties.description: The namespace of the metric.

type.description: The namespace of the metric.

TargetTrackingMetricDimension.description: Describes the dimension of a metric.

properties.name: Name
properties.description: The name of the dimension.

type.description: The name of the dimension.

properties.name: Value
properties.description: The value of the dimension.

type.description: The value of the dimension.

StepAdjustment.description: Represents a step adjustment for a StepScalingPolicyConfiguration. Describes an adjustment based on the difference between the value of the aggregated CloudWatch metric and the breach threshold that you've defined for the alarm.

properties.name: MetricIntervalLowerBound
properties.description: The lower bound for the difference between the alarm threshold and the CloudWatch metric. If the metric value is above the breach threshold, the lower bound is inclusive (the metric must be greater than or equal to the threshold plus the lower bound). Otherwise, it is exclusive (the metric must be greater than the threshold plus the lower bound). A null value indicates negative infinity.

type.description: The lower bound for the difference between the alarm threshold and the CloudWatch metric. If the metric value is above the breach threshold, the lower bound is inclusive (the metric must be greater than or equal to the threshold plus the lower bound). Otherwise, it is exclusive (the metric must be greater than the threshold plus the lower bound). A null value indicates negative infinity.

properties.name: MetricIntervalUpperBound
properties.description: The upper bound for the difference between the alarm threshold and the CloudWatch metric. If the metric value is above the breach threshold, the upper bound is exclusive (the metric must be less than the threshold plus the upper bound). Otherwise, it is inclusive (the metric must be less than or equal to the threshold plus the upper bound). A null value indicates positive infinity.

type.description: The upper bound for the difference between the alarm threshold and the CloudWatch metric. If the metric value is above the breach threshold, the upper bound is exclusive (the metric must be less than the threshold plus the upper bound). Otherwise, it is inclusive (the metric must be less than or equal to the threshold plus the upper bound). A null value indicates positive infinity.

properties.name: ScalingAdjustment
properties.description: The amount by which to scale, based on the specified adjustment type. A positive value adds to the current capacity while a negative number removes from the current capacity. For exact capacity, you must specify a positive value.

type.description: The amount by which to scale, based on the specified adjustment type. A positive value adds to the current capacity while a negative number removes from the current capacity. For exact capacity, you must specify a positive value.

MetricDimension.description: Describes the dimension names and values associated with a metric.

properties.name: Name
properties.description: The name of the dimension.

type.description: The name of the dimension.

properties.name: Value
properties.description: The value of the dimension.

type.description: The value of the dimension.

properties.name: PolicyName
properties.description:
The name of the scaling policy.

Updates to the name of a target tracking scaling policy are not supported, unless you also update the metric used for scaling. To change only a target tracking scaling policy's name, first delete the policy by removing the existing AWS::ApplicationAutoScaling::ScalingPolicy resource from the template and updating the stack. Then, recreate the resource with the same settings and a different name.

type.description:
The name of the scaling policy.

Updates to the name of a target tracking scaling policy are not supported, unless you also update the metric used for scaling. To change only a target tracking scaling policy's name, first delete the policy by removing the existing AWS::ApplicationAutoScaling::ScalingPolicy resource from the template and updating the stack. Then, recreate the resource with the same settings and a different name.

properties.name: PolicyType
properties.description:
The scaling policy type.

The following policy types are supported:

TargetTrackingScaling Not supported for Amazon EMR

StepScaling Not supported for DynamoDB, Amazon Comprehend, Lambda, Amazon Keyspaces, Amazon MSK, Amazon ElastiCache, or Neptune.

type.description:
The scaling policy type.

The following policy types are supported:

TargetTrackingScaling Not supported for Amazon EMR

StepScaling Not supported for DynamoDB, Amazon Comprehend, Lambda, Amazon Keyspaces, Amazon MSK, Amazon ElastiCache, or Neptune.

properties.name: ResourceId
properties.description: The identifier of the resource associated with the scaling policy. This string consists of the resource type and unique identifier.

type.description: The identifier of the resource associated with the scaling policy. This string consists of the resource type and unique identifier.

properties.name: ScalableDimension
properties.description: The scalable dimension. This string consists of the service namespace, resource type, and scaling property.

type.description: The scalable dimension. This string consists of the service namespace, resource type, and scaling property.

properties.name: ScalingTargetId
properties.description: The CloudFormation-generated ID of an Application Auto Scaling scalable target. For more information about the ID, see the Return Value section of the AWS::ApplicationAutoScaling::ScalableTarget resource.

type.description: The CloudFormation-generated ID of an Application Auto Scaling scalable target. For more information about the ID, see the Return Value section of the AWS::ApplicationAutoScaling::ScalableTarget resource.

properties.name: ServiceNamespace
properties.description: The namespace of the AWS service that provides the resource, or a custom-resource.

type.description: The namespace of the AWS service that provides the resource, or a custom-resource.

properties.name: StepScalingPolicyConfiguration
properties.description: A step scaling policy.

type.description: A step scaling policy.

properties.name: TargetTrackingScalingPolicyConfiguration
properties.description: A target tracking scaling policy.

type.description: A target tracking scaling policy.

properties.name: Arn
properties.description: ARN is a read only property for the resource.

type.description: ARN is a read only property for the resource.
